pullRequest.title: [amazonechocontrol] Too many requests issue, Parallel and overlapping tts and announcement, Volume, Some fixes
pullRequest.bodyText:
Changed: Sequence tts and announcement (act) to parallel tts and act (do not convert a tts to announcement)
Fixed: too many request issue for tts and act via queue
Fixed: overlapping tts and act (multiple outputs in a short interval interrupt each other)
Fixed: ttsVolume (set tts volume, output tts or act, set user volume)
Fixed: ignore empty tts or act
Fixed: delay between requests
Fixed: crossing requests via queue (interrupt each other and produce too many requests)
Fixed: ssml for tts (able to use sound and ssml)
Main feature
Grouped or stacked tts and act
Main fix
Too many requests
I confirm that all my commits in this PR are my own work.
Signed-off-by: Tom Blum (Trinitus01) trinitus01@googlemail.com

commit.message:
added: channel for account announcements (to all devices)
added: channel to play sound of Alexa Skills Kit Sound Library
added: stacked or grouped announcements (too many request fix)
added: sequenced stacked or grouped textToSpeech (too many request fix)
added: ttsvolume in stacked or grouped announcements & sequenced textToSpeech (too many request fix)
removed: stacked or grouped textToSpeech converted to announcements
fixed: update or refresh volume immediately after a command (before updated on second command and broke ttsvolume, command, volume sequence)
fixed: update or refresh volume immediately after manual echo button press (before did not update or refresh anyway)
fixed: do not show xml tags on echos with display during announcements

added: description of new features to the README
changed: the description for the thing type sound

changed: .properties encoding to ISO-8859-1
changed: @author-tag to real name
applied: apply spotless-formatter

changed: sequenced tts to parallel tts
fixed: parallel websocket messages produces too many requests (queued delay websocket messages)
fixed: overlapping tts (queued delay tts messages)
removed: sound channel, better to use tts ssml
fixed: do not convert a tts to an announcement if ssml is used, tts can also handle ssml

Signed-off-by: Tom Blum (Trinitus01) <trinitus01@googlemail.com>
changed: try to reduce some conflicts (the easy stuff)
changed: try to reduce some conflicts (the easy stuff) (2)
changed: try to reduce some conflicts (the easy stuff) (3)

changed: channel name accountAnnouncement to sendAnnouncement

Signed-off-by: Tom Blum (Trinitus01) <trinitus01@googlemail.com>

fixed: unhandled exception stop tts
fixed: try to reduce crossing requests because of too many requests

Signed-off-by: Tom Blum (Trinitus01) <trinitus01@googlemail.com>

added: ttsVolume for every single device (tts)
fixed: lastKnownVolume and ttsVolume issue (tts)

Signed-off-by: Tom Blum (Trinitus01) <trinitus01@googlemail.com>

added: ttsVolume for every single device (announcement)
fixed: lastKnownVolume and ttsVolume issue (announcement)

Signed-off-by: Tom Blum (Trinitus01) <trinitus01@googlemail.com>

fixed: ttsVolume for announcements

Signed-off-by: Tom Blum (Trinitus01) <trinitus01@googlemail.com>

removed: channel for account announcements (better to use grouped or stacked announcements)

Signed-off-by: Tom Blum (Trinitus01) <trinitus01@googlemail.com>

fixed: check for empty text (tts and announcement)
changed: the way to extract text from xml (before it did not work for less than 3 chars)

Signed-off-by: Tom Blum (Trinitus01) <trinitus01@googlemail.com>

removed: debug information logging
fixed: finally fixed crossing requests
fixed: ttsVolume and lastKnownVolume (tts and announcement) (was still broken before)

Signed-off-by: Tom Blum (Trinitus01) <trinitus01@googlemail.com>
